Comment.MultiLanguageText: the scantime of this EM/phase, used to increase timers
complete steptime in seconds. same value as the other steptimes
complete steptime in minutes. same value as the other steptimes
complete steptime in hours. same value as the other steptimes
first scan of the step active
last scan of the step active
em_id doesn't fit in the index db
Pressure Controller - Switch to External Mode
Pressure Controller - Operator Setpoint in Internal Mode
Pressure Controller - Switch to Auto Mode
Automatic Bottom Valve - Auto command from program
Manual Bottom Valve - Auto command from program
Trnasfer Valve to M04 - Auto command from program
UDT for receiving Setpoints and sending Process Values
pulse active on the first cycle of a new scan
address in the Index Table DB
length of the Index Table DB

AttributeList.Text: The EM will publish its DB number to the EM Index table
Publish DB number to EM Index

NetworkSource.StatementList:
L #SP_PV.Request T Request
L #SP_PV.Command T Command
L #SP_PV.Pressure_SP T Pressure_SP

AttributeList.Text: Copy all Setpoints from the UDT

NetworkSource.StatementList: L Request T Owner

AttributeList.Text: If the previous Command is not the same as the current one then reset the timers, else increase them This is at the start of the FB because normal commandchanges will take till the next cycle to become active

NetworkSource.StatementList: L Command L previous_Command <>I = initial_scan

AttributeList.Text: create a pulse active on the first cycle of a new scan this signal can be used in the state to execute some actions in the first cycle of the state

NetworkSource.StatementList: L Command T previous_Command
CLR O Pump_QERR O Pump_EERR O PIC01_ERR O LT01_ERR O XV_Bottom_MERR O BV_Bottom_MERR O BV_Tran_M04_MERR = CM_error

AttributeList.Text: Collect the errors from the CMs

NetworkSource.StatementList:
CLR
// clear the error no L 0 T CM_error_no
A Pump_QERR JCN E1
L 50 // 'CM error: Pump_QERR' T CM_error_no
E1: NOP 0
A Pump_EERR JCN E2
L 51 // 'CM error: Pump_EERR' T CM_error_no
E2: NOP 0
A PIC01_ERR JCN E3
L 52 // 'CM error: PIC01_ERR' T CM_error_no
E3: NOP 0
A LT01_ERR JCN E4
L 53 // 'CM error: LT01_ERR' T CM_error_no
E4: NOP 0
A XV_Bottom_MERR JCN E5
L 54 // 'CM error: XV_Bottom_MERR' T CM_error_no
E5: NOP 0
A BV_Bottom_MERR JCN E6
L 55 // 'CM error: BV_Bottom_MERR' T CM_error_no
E6: NOP 0
A BV_Tran_M04_MERR JCN E7
L 56 // 'CM error: BV_Tran_M04_MERR' T CM_error_no
E7: NOP 0

AttributeList.Text: This code tries to assign an error message to each CM error If multiple CMs have an error then it only stores one This is the EM type so we don't know which CM instance is connected So the error only contains the general name of the CM instance If the actual name needs to be shown then it could be deducted at a higher level using the CM name and EM instance network_end.render(lib, "ssign a message number to each error") }}
Assign a message number to each error

NetworkSource.StatementList: // empty placeholder network
// jump location for the state that is currently active ENDS: NOP 0

L Owner T #SP_PV.Owner
L Status T #SP_PV.Status
A CM_error = #SP_PV.CM_error
L CM_error_no T #SP_PV.CM_error_no
A q_bACTVIE = #SP_PV.q_bACTVIE
L Level T #SP_PV.Level
L Pressure T #SP_PV.Pressure

AttributeList.Text: Copy all Process Values to the UDT

NetworkSource.StatementList: L 0 T request

AttributeList.Text: Phases don't clean up their requests on the EM side So at the end of the EM reset the request If the phase is still there then it will write the request again by the next scan

NetworkSource.StatementList: // empty placeholder network
